item.title: Measuring the effect of corrective short-term updates for wind energy forecasts on intraday electricity prices
item.description: This paper investigates the impact of wind energy updates on intraday prices and proposes the use of merit-order-based models to counter price uncertainties stemming from updates.

item.title: Risks of long-term auto loans
item.description: The authors investigate the borrower risk factors, delinquency rates, yield curves, and interest rates of long-term auto loans.

item.title: Forecasting the realized volatility of stock markets with financial stress
item.description: This paper investigates the impact of financial stress on the predictability of the realized volatility of five stock markets

item.title: Counterparty risk allocation
item.description: This paper investigates the problem of minimizing the risk of exposure to a small number of defaultable counterparties based on spectral risk measures.

item.title: Risk contagion and bank stability: the role of credit risk and liquidity risk
item.description: The authors put forward a systemic risk measurement model and measure systemic risk in China's banking sector for the period 2013-18.

item.title: Model risk in mortality-linked contingent claims pricing
item.description: The authors investigate the influence of model risk on pricing life products and demonstrate that classical Lee-Carter-type models can be less accurate than the proposed model.

item.title: Is volatility a friend or enemy of your stock and fund investments?
item.description: The authors investigate the role of past volatility in the cross section of returns on US stocks, equity mutual funds and corporate bond funds.

item.title: Islamic mutual funds: contracts, structures, screening and pricing mechanisms
item.description: The authors investigate the contracts, structures, screening, pricing mechanisms of Islamic Mutual Funds and attempt to harmonize and standardize the benchmarks of these funds

item.title: Quantification of model risk with an application to probability of default estimation and stress testing for a large corporate portfolio
item.description: This paper discusses the building of obligor-level rather than segment-level hazard rate corporate probability of default models for stress testing.

item.title: The statistics of capture ratios
item.description: This paper investigates the statistical problem of estimating the capture ratio based on a finite number of observations of a fund’s returns.

item.title: Adjoint differentiation for generic matrix functions
item.description: The authors develop and apply a formula to derive closed-form expressions in particular quantitative finance cases.

item.title: Simulating the Cox–Ingersoll–Ross and Heston processes: matching the first four moments
item.description: This paper investigates various techniques for the CIR and Heston models.

item.title: How does the pandemic change operational risk? Evidence from textual risk disclosures in financial reports
item.description: The authors investigate changes in operational risk profiles of the financial industry following the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Multilevel Monte Carlo simulation for VIX options in the rough Bergomi model
item.description: The authors consider the pricing of the Chicago Board options Exchange VIX, demonstrating experiments highlighting the efficiency of a multilevel approach in pricing of VIX options.

item.title: Modeling systemic operational risk in the Covid-19 pandemic
item.description: This paper introduces existing and novel epidemiology models and investigates how government responses to the Covid-19 pandemic impacted these models.

item.title: Pricing the correlation skew with normal mean–variance mixture copulas
item.description: The author puts forward a pricing methodology for European multi-asset derivatives that consists of a flexible copula-based method that can reproduce the correlation skew and is efficient enough for use with large baskets.

item.title: Creating factor clusters in the alternative Undertakings for Collective Investment in Transferable Securities (UCITS) universe
item.description: The authors identify 7 clusters and provide insight into their current or prospective UCITS holdings by observing their performance in the context of the relevant cluster.

item.title: Changes in operational risk and its determinants under Covid-19
item.description: The authors investigate the operational risk impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on Chinese commercial banks and the moderating effect of bank size, business diversification and regulatory records.

item.title: “Closing the gaps: moving forward on tail risks in central clearing”: a central bank of issue perspective
item.description: The authors explain the priorities for CCP recovery and resolution from a central bank of issue perspective, focussing on structural barriers and how gaps could be overcome.

item.title: Distance to default based on the CEV–KMV model
Model risk quantification based on relative entropy
item.description: This paper proposes a minimum relative entropy technique for challenging derivatives pricing models that can also assess the model risk of a target portfolio.

item.title: An effective credit rating method for corporate entities using machine learning
item.description: The authors propose a new method to design credit risk rating models for corporate entities using a meta-algorithm which exploits information embedded in expert-assigned credit ratings to rank customers.

item.title: A multivariate model for hybrid wind–photovoltaic power production with energy portfolio optimization
item.description: The authors model the power production and income of a wind-photovoltaic energy plant to determine the portfolio that maximises profitability as well as the optimal choice between wind and photovoltaic plants.

item.title: Stressing of migration matrixes for International Financial Reporting Standard 9 and Internal Capital Adequacy Assessment Process calculations
item.description: This paper demonstrates that correlation estimates are sensitive to model assumptions and estimation methodology by comparing three methods used to stress rating transition matrixes.

item.title: Generalized additive modeling of the credit risk of Korean personal bank loans
item.description: The authors demonstrate a nonlinear impact of loan and borrower characteristics when applying a GAM framework to personal loans taken from a Korean bank.

item.title: Stressed distance to default and default risk
item.description: The authors propose a stressed version of distance to default to measure time-varying corporate default risk in the event of a systematic stress scenario.

item.title: Quantifying model selection risk in macroeconomic sensitivity models
item.description: The authors compare forecasts and uncertainties of three possibilities in model selection: the model selected as best, the best ensemble and the model not selected.

item.title: A two-component realized exponential generalized autoregressive conditional heteroscedasticity model
item.description: The authors propose a two-component EGARCH model for the modeling of asset returns and realized measures of volatility.

item.title: Shrinking beta
item.description: The authors shrink correlation and volatility separately and evaluate the predictive power of this approach, finding economically and statistically significant gains from applying more shrinkage to correlations than to volatilities.

item.title: Do DEXs work? Using Uniswap V2 to explore the effectiveness of decentralized exchanges
item.description: The authors investigate the effectiveness of the Ether–Tether liquidity pool on the Uniswap V2 and note that cointegration between the price set by the liquidity pool and its price elsewhere is a necessary condition of effectiveness.

item.title: Dynamic spillover between the crude oil, natural gas and BRICS stock markets
item.description: This paper investigates the dynamic spillover between crude oil, natural gas and the stock markets in Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa (BRICS).

item.title: Choice of margin period of risk and netting for computing margins in central counterparty clearinghouses: a Monte Carlo investigation
item.description: The authors provide a quantitative comparison for evaluating the impact of collecting margins in a gross-versus-net system with the margin period of risk (MPOR) set to between one and five days.

item.title: Forecasting the European Monetary Union equity risk premium with regression trees
item.description: The authors use EMU data from the period between 2000 to 2020 to forecast equity risk premium and investigate Classification and Regression Trees.

item.title: Optimal trade execution with uncertain volume target
item.description: This paper demonstrates that risk-averse traders can benefit from delaying trades using a model that accounts for volume uncertainty.

item.title: A novel derivation and interpretation of the Kelly criterion
item.description: The authors apply an information-theoretical argument to a Bernoulli process to find least biased investment strategy consistent with expected exponential growth.

item.title: A three-factor hazard rate model for single-name credit default swap pricing
item.description: The authors propose a reduced-form model in which the evolution of the risk-neutral hazard rate is driven by three risk factors.

item.title: Repo haircuts and economic capital: a theory of repo pricing
item.description: The author proposes a repo haircut model that will identify capital for repo default risk as the main driver of repo spreads and allow investors to settle at an optimal combination of the haircut and repo rate.

item.title: Exploring the equity–bond relationship in a low-rate environment with unsupervised learning
item.description: The authors apply k-means clustering to low interest rate periods in order to analyze the equity hedging property of government bonds.

item.title: Merton’s model with recovery risk
item.description: By adding a correlated risk driver to Merton's model for corporate bond pricing, the authors model the empirically observed recovery risk premium.

item.title: A general firm value model under partial information
item.description: The authors propose a general structural default model combining enhanced economic relevance and affordable computational complexity.

item.title: General bounds on the area under the receiver operating characteristic curve and other performance measures when only a single sensitivity and specificity point is known
item.description: Using a single true positive - true negative pair, the author shows how to calculate the area under a ROC curve.

item.title: Do sovereign wealth funds dampen the effect of oil market volatility on gross domestic product growth?
item.description: This paper uses a smooth transition regression model to examine the role of SWF asset growth in lessening the effect of oil market volatility on GDP growth.

item.title: Application of the moving Lyapunov exponent to the S&P 500 index to predict major declines
item.description: The authors suggest an innovative method based in econophysics that provides early warning signs for major declines in the S&P 500 Index

item.title: Deep learning for efficient frontier calculation in finance
item.description: The author puts forward a means to calculate the efficient frontier in the Mean-Variance and Mean-CVaR portfolio optimization problems using deep neural network algorithms.

item.title: Future portfolio returns and the VIX term structure
item.description: The authors use a measure that captures the expected evolution of risk and generate results supportive of the concept that there are multiple facets within volatility risk that are priced individually.

item.title: Subsampling and other considerations for efficient risk estimation in large portfolios
item.description: The authors apply multilevel Monte Carlo simulation to the problems inherent in computing risk measures of a financial portfolio with large numbers of derivatives.

item.title: A new approach to detecting change in credit quality
item.description: The author presents a new, computationally simple framework for quantifying and detecting changes in established companies' corporate credit quality.

item.title: Detecting prudence and temperance in risk exposure: the hybrid variance framework
item.description: This paper analyses the correlations between returns and HVs in the short and long terms while developing a risk measure designed to contain the impacts of prudence and temperance on risk aversion.

item.title: How climate change may impact operational risk
item.description: This paper uses the ten laws of operational risk along with taxonomies for inadequacies or failures and their impacts, and it also draws parallels with past crises, in order to make systematic predictions.

item.title: Expected shortfall model based on a neural network
item.description: This paper presents a model that combines ES models based on EVT and neural networks and meets all criteria for the validity of the Basel III standard.
